alert.note: Alert for Benton; DeSoto; Marshall; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 9:10PM CDT until April 15 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Crittenden County in eastern Arkansas... DeSoto County in northwestern Mississippi... Northern Marshall County in northwestern Mississippi... Northeastern Tunica County in northwestern Mississippi... Central Tate County in northwestern Mississippi... Northwestern Benton County in northeastern Mississippi... Southeastern Tipton County in west Tennessee... Fayette County in west Tennessee... Hardeman County in west Tennessee... Southern Haywood County in west Tennessee... Shelby County in west Tennessee... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 908 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Covington to Germantown to Robinsonville, moving east at 50 mph. Strong outflow winds will precede this line of thunderstorms. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, West Memphis, Horn Lake, Hernando, Millington, Senatobia, Holly Springs, Bolivar, T O Fuller State Park, Chickasaw State Forest, Cordova, Memphis, Lamar, Lakeland, Arlington and Munford. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
